title: Question 17
prompt: A teenage girl is considering either eating a whole orange or drinking a glass of orange juice with breakfast. Based on the above nutritional facts, which of the following is the true?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: Orange juice and a whole orange each contain some needed nutrients. There are some differences in calories, potassium, carbohydrates, protein, vitamins, and minerals, but these differences don’t make either a bad choice. Either could be a part of a balanced diet, along with other foods that could provide additional dietary requirements.
